page.title: 07Local Historic Buildings
page.content: {Bowes Castle} Bowes Castle was built in the 12th century by the Normans.King John visited it in 1206 and 1212 and his niece Eleanor,sister of Prince Arthur, was detained here.The keep walls were about 3 or 4 feet thick.It had a spiral staircase on the inside of the keep.By 1314-22 the North of England was devastated by Robert Bruce,King of Scotland.There was so much damage done to it that it was considered of no value for defence and in the 17th century it was dismantled.It is now an impressive monument. {St. Giles' Church} The church is dedicated to St. Giles.It is dated from the Norman period.It was restored in 1865.The font is 12th century even though it bears a date of 1622.There are lots of old graves including a roman memorial stone (continued)
